users_table¶

class tracktor_server.users_table.Users(db_name)¶

Bases: object

Class to manage connection to the backend Users table.

This class provides methods to to write/read from a SQLite database directly, while main.py handles the requests and calls on these functions.

db_name¶

The name of the SQLite database file.

Type:

str

connection¶

The database connection.

Type:

sqlite3.Connection or None

add_user(username, password)¶

Adds a new user to the database.

Parameters:

  • username (str) – The username for the new user.

  • password (str) – The plaintext password for the new user.

Returns:

The ID of the newly created user.

Return type:

int

get_db()¶

Opens the named database or creates one if it doesn’t exist.

Returns:

The db connection object.

Return type:

sqlite3.Connection

get_user(user_id)¶

Gets user data from the table based on user_id.

Parameters:

user_id (int) – The ID of the user.

Returns:

The user row, or None if not found.

Return type:

sqlite3.Row

get_users()¶

Gets all users from the database.

Returns:

A list of all user rows.

Return type:

list[sqlite3.Row]

init_users_table()¶

Creates and SQL table for users if it doesn’t already exist.

verify_user(username, password)¶

Verifies a user with username and password.

Parameters:

  • username (str) – The username to verify.

  • password (str) – The plaintext password to verify.

Returns:

(bool, int or None). True and user ID if credentials are correct, otherwise False and None.

Return type:

tuple

Tracktor VFX
